I also had a chicken katsu and a couple of rolls which was pretty good. Oooo....and I loved their organic cheesecake. The sweetness of it was perfect and it was very creamy and crusty!

excerpts: They also have great combo boxes that come with the selection of 3 different dishes per box.
Overall great place to come with a group of friends!
combo.author: Annie C.
combo.review:
Came here to celebrate a friend's birthday, the atmosphere was very lively and fun! Lots of people in their 20's come to sake bomb. Happy hour is 5-7pm, the happy hour menu has a wide selection of basic rolls, appetizers, and drinks. They also have great combo boxes that come with the selection of 3 different dishes per box. 
Overall great place to come with a group of friends!

excerpts: Food here is pretty cheap, I ordered the nigiri combo and my boyfriend got the combo box.
Both individually under $25 so pretty cheap!
Quality is ok, not too fresh and the katsu chicken was soggy, but for the price it's decent.
I think its a great place for big gatherings and get your drink on!
combo.author: Natalie L.
combo.review:
Looking for a good place for a birthday party? This place can be it! For $20 all you can drink sake and beer, you sure will get your money worth and have a good time!

Food here is pretty cheap, I ordered the nigiri combo and my boyfriend got the combo box. Both individually under $25 so pretty cheap! Quality is ok, not too fresh and the katsu chicken was soggy, but for the price it's decent. I think its a great place for big gatherings and get your drink on!

excerpts: I ordered the combo meal with salmon sashimi that comes with salad, soup and rice.
Unfortunately, the waiter forgot to bring out my soup.
It seemed like a great deal for $15 for 12 pieces of salmon sashimi, especially for me since I love salmon sushi.
However, the cuts were thin and the salad was drenched in thousand island.
Boyfriend ordered the chirashi which had 9 pieces of sashimi placed on top of a small scoop of rice with vegetables and roe on the side.
Presentation was lacking and it was the smallest chirashi I've ever seen.
My friend had the nigiri combo and a roll.
combo.author: Helen C.
combo.review:
Wasn't so impressed by this place. I was hoping that they would step up their game considering that they have competitors nearby (Zushi Puzzle, Atami & Yuzu). The one good thing is that they have happy hour drink specials on the weekends. All beer and sake are 50% off.

I ordered the combo meal with salmon sashimi that comes with salad, soup and rice. Unfortunately, the waiter forgot to bring out my soup. It seemed like a great deal for $15 for 12 pieces of salmon sashimi, especially for me since I love salmon sushi. However, the cuts were thin and the salad was drenched in thousand island. Boyfriend ordered the chirashi which had 9 pieces of sashimi placed on top of a small scoop of rice with vegetables and roe on the side. Presentation was lacking and it was the smallest chirashi I've ever seen. My friend had the nigiri combo and a roll. I'd say his dishes were better.

The service was okay. Our dishes came out at separate times. It seems as though the restaurant is run by a bunch of young guys. The décor was lacking and the music was loud. Large parties started to trickle in throughout the night, making the restaurant even louder.

excerpts: The bento box combo and happy hour sake/beer deal is fantastic!
It's not fancy or anything, but a comfortable and quiet place to get warm Japanese food (they have donburi and standard bento box fare) and a few rolls!
combo.author: Kari L.
combo.review: This place is great for casual Japanese food.  It's low key, reasonably priced (one of those rare Marina places that isn't overpriced and has been around for a while) and the service is nice. The bento box combo and happy hour sake/beer deal is fantastic!  It's not fancy or anything, but a comfortable and quiet place to get warm Japanese food (they have donburi and standard bento box fare) and a few rolls!

excerpts: We (family of 4) ordered the following: edamame, seaweed salad, chaotic roll, beef udon soup, and a sushi combo (salmon, tuna, etc.)
It was all delicious.
The udon soup was a huge portion and easily fed our kid (they shared), with some to spare.
The chaotic roll was unbelievably fresh and delicious.
The combo was a fantastic deal at $15---tons of tasty food.
combo.author: Erin S.
combo.review:
We are in town for a few nights, staying at a hotel across the street. After a busy evening of sightseeing, we wanted to get as far away from Fisherman's Wharf as possible for dinner. We were craving sushi, and saw this restaurant across the street from our hotel. On a whim, we went in and WOW! Was it delicious!

First off, it's Sunday night and they offer a 15% discount (quieter than a Fri or Sat night). We (family of 4) ordered the following: edamame, seaweed salad, chaotic roll, beef udon soup, and a sushi combo (salmon, tuna, etc.) It was all delicious. The udon soup was a huge portion and easily fed our kid (they shared), with some to spare. The chaotic roll was unbelievably fresh and delicious. The combo was a fantastic deal at $15---tons of tasty food. 

Definitely flee the tourist spots for this quaint neighborhood sushi restaurant. You will be glad you did!

excerpts:
It was a little rowdy inside and quite a few sake bombs were taken loudly by large tables.
Came with a group of four, we had some sashimi, several rolls of different variety and some Sapporo and sake.

They don't have mixed drinks just wine,
Beer and sake. 
Wine list is not impressive stick to
Beer and sake. 
The waitstaff definitely could be more attentive but overall it was a good time.
sake.author: Jessica W.
sake.review:
This place is kind of a divvy sushi bar. The sushi itself is good quality, thank goodness or there may have been some issues! But it's definitely an inexpensive place with a younger crowd. 
It was a little rowdy inside and quite a few sake bombs were taken loudly by large tables.

The waitstaff definitely could be more attentive but overall it was a good time.

All in all it's the bomb

excerpts: We made a reservation for a Friday evening to try out the all you can drink sake bombs.
For $20 and for someone who does not love sake bombs, I was pleasantly surprised.
Sake was tasty, beer was cold, and the service was stellar.
We had about 25 people in our party but some of the other tables in the restaurant were battling us with sake bombs too!
A great pregame environment and well worth the $20.
Only complaint was it was about 80 degrees inside the restaurant...
lots and lots of flushed cheeks even before the sake began.
p.s.
We didn't eat anything there
so can't give any recommendation on food.
sake.author: Kara N.
sake.review: We made a reservation for a Friday evening to try out the all you can drink sake bombs. For $20 and for someone who does not love sake bombs, I was pleasantly surprised. Sake was tasty, beer was cold, and the service was stellar. We had about 25 people in our party but some of the other tables in the restaurant were battling us with sake bombs too! A great pregame environment and well worth the $20. Only complaint was it was about 80 degrees inside the restaurant...lots and lots of flushed cheeks even before the sake began. p.s. We didn't eat anything there so can't give any recommendation on food.

excerpts: The #1 spot in town for 16 year olds to show their patently bogus IDs and be served sake bombs by an owner who doesn't care.
Must be a great profit driver.
I guess the tourists don't mind so
sake.author: John M.
sake.review:
The #1 spot in town for 16 year olds to show their patently bogus IDs and be served sake bombs by an owner who doesn't care. Must be a great profit driver. I guess the tourists don't mind so on we go. 

How do these people keep their license?

excerpts: At least the bottomless sake bombs help take the edge off.
sake.author: Paola M.
sake.review:
SO infuriated by this place. 

I made reservations for 5 for my birthday. I called and they said they couldn't accommodate my group until 9:30 p.m. Okay, I accept. 

I show up at 9 p.m. and decipher from the small amount of English spoken that they lost my reservation because the lady who picked up the phone for me didn't write it down. I'm told we can sit at the bar and wait for the next table to open up.

1,2,3,6 tables open up and over and over they refuse to seat us at one of them. People with 9:45-10p.m reservations are prioritized over us, and we are told that only 1 table in the restaurant would be okay for us... ridiculous. 

Service was painfully slow and they lacked in every way- food came out at random times leaving some people waiting 1 hour to start eating, waiting for others to get their food. At least the bottomless sake bombs help take the edge off. 

Check comes, surprise surprise: they added a 25% surcharge for having a party of 6 or more--we were a party of 5! Fraudulent too. 

Shady, bad service, nonexistent customer service----I will NEVER be back and will warn everyone about this place.

excerpts: Happy hour is 5-10pm, so pretty much any time you'd be going to dinner, and gets you 50% off beer and sake.
They also have an unlimited sake and beer special which I believe is $20.
sake.author: Sara M.
sake.review:
Underrated. Great prices for fresh sushi and good service.

Let's start with the amazing drink specials. Happy hour is 5-10pm, so pretty much any time you'd be going to dinner, and gets you 50% off beer and sake. They also have an unlimited sake and beer special which I believe is $20.

Sushi is yummy. We got a few sashimi orders to share and they were very generous portions. My friends love the specialty maki rolls.

excerpts: but you are going for the atmosphere and unlimited Sake Bombs
:) Would not go here on a date, Friday or Saturday night as you will not be able to talk with each other (Gets loud).
Go with a group and put your party pants on!
sake.author: Ian E.
sake.review: You are going to come here for a birthday or some type of festivity. The food is okay but you are going for the atmosphere and unlimited Sake Bombs :) Would not go here on a date, Friday or Saturday night as you will not be able to talk with each other (Gets loud). Go with a group and put your party pants on!

excerpts: After weighing out the cost efficiency of AYCD and the happy hour drink menu (50% off beer and house/hot sake), we decided to go with the 50% off, as we did not think we would be spending 80 bucks on alcohol between 4 people.
sake.author: Genevieve M.
sake.review:
Started here for a GNO with the coworkers. Happy hour for food ends at 7pm and happy hour for drinks ends at 10pm. We were seated at about 6:50pm on a Saturday night, so we ordered as much happy hour nigiri as we could before 7. After weighing out the cost efficiency of AYCD and the happy hour drink menu (50% off beer and house/hot sake), we decided to go with the 50% off, as we did not think we would be spending 80 bucks on alcohol between 4 people. 

The food:

- standard for nigiri, however the rice was kind of hard..
- ordered the Lion King roll (I am a cream cheese fanatic) and it was overall meh and the amount of cream cheese in it was insulting, if there was even any there at all
- ordered the beef teriyaki dinner and it was super dry and overcooked
- overall taste for everything else we ordered was satisfactory

The atmosphere:

- standard sushi bar
- Small venue, but a good amount of tables and there's a sushi bar to sit at as well
- gets loud, as the AYCD and happy hour prices can attest to
- service was an issue, the servers forgot multiple times things that we ordered.. so had to remind them and wait even longer.. and that's if we could even flag down a server to begin with

At a glance: only good for drinks.

excerpts: Recommend for birthdays because the Sake Bombs are BOMBBBB
sake.author: Lena M.
sake.review: Honestly their service is amazing and I always have a good time when I go. Recommend for birthdays because the Sake Bombs are BOMBBBB

excerpts: This is the place to go with a big group of friends for unlimited sake bombing (2 hours for $20pp).
Sushi is pretty delicious as well, but with the price of sushi and sake, it can get up there for a big group.
sake.author: Kerry G.
sake.review:
Marina Sushi is WAY FUN on a weekend night. This is the place to go with a big group of friends for unlimited sake bombing (2 hours for $20pp). Sushi is pretty delicious as well, but with the price of sushi and sake, it can get up there for a big group.

Make sure to ask if you can play your own music, they usually let you and it makes for a really fun experience!

excerpts: All beer and sake are 50% off.
sake.author: Helen C.
sake.review:
Wasn't so impressed by this place. I was hoping that they would step up their game considering that they have competitors nearby (Zushi Puzzle, Atami & Yuzu). The one good thing is that they have happy hour drink specials on the weekends. All beer and sake are 50% off.

I ordered the combo meal with salmon sashimi that comes with salad, soup and rice. Unfortunately, the waiter forgot to bring out my soup. It seemed like a great deal for $15 for 12 pieces of salmon sashimi, especially for me since I love salmon sushi. However, the cuts were thin and the salad was drenched in thousand island. Boyfriend ordered the chirashi which had 9 pieces of sashimi placed on top of a small scoop of rice with vegetables and roe on the side. Presentation was lacking and it was the smallest chirashi I've ever seen. My friend had the nigiri combo and a roll. I'd say his dishes were better.

The service was okay. Our dishes came out at separate times. It seems as though the restaurant is run by a bunch of young guys. The décor was lacking and the music was loud. Large parties started to trickle in throughout the night, making the restaurant even louder.

excerpts: , we left happy about cheap happy hour sake and beers, woke up with upset stomachs, vomiting and diarrhea.
sake.author: Liz A.
sake.review:
four words: upset stomachs for everyone 

came here for a bday dinner, we left happy about cheap happy hour sake and beers, woke up with upset stomachs, vomiting and diarrhea. 

not to mention, the food took awhile (it was busy), so i wonder if they rushed and unfortunately didn't properly serve food that was ready. unfortunate, but it is what it is.

otherwise, a chill place to have fun dinners for those in their early 20s who like to party.

excerpts: The one I used to go to (Sake Zone) closed down.
So I've been on the search ever since but have missed the mark every time till now.
Every dish was delicious and amazingly fresh.
We where so excited we forgot to take photos, LOL!
I am so coming back with more friends.
sake.author: Crystal P.
sake.review: OMG! This is now my all time favorite sushi house! The one I used to go to (Sake Zone) closed down. So I've been on the search ever since but have missed the mark every time till now. Every dish was delicious and amazingly fresh. We where so excited we forgot to take photos, LOL! I am so coming back with more friends.

excerpts: They also didn't mind at all that most tables in the restaurant were doing multiple rounds of sake bombs!
Overall, fun and solid sushi/sake bomb experience!
sake.author: Emmy Q.
sake.review:
Really fun place to come with big groups. On a Thursday, my friends and I decided to organize a big group dinner for the following day. We thought it would be impossible to get a reservation anywhere for 13 people, but Marina Sushi helped us out! Once we arrived, we were seated right away and had multiple servers helping us out at all times. 

The House Special roll is amazing. Deep fried rolls usually make me feel sick, but this felt fresh with that deep fried, delicious taste! If you're looking for something non-deep fried, the Fairytale Yellowtail is really great and fresh.

The nice thing about Marina Sushi is that the environment encourages you to have fun. They offered to play music from the playlists on our phones. They also didn't mind at all that most tables in the restaurant were doing multiple rounds of sake bombs!

Overall, fun and solid sushi/sake bomb experience!

excerpts: Great place for a group of friends who want to sake bomb and party!
The wait staff is extremely attentive to groups that are sake bombing...
Basically they keep the sake and beer flowing if you ask them to.
The rolls are great and nicely priced too.
Get the House special for sure!
sake.author: Julia M.
sake.review: Great place for a group of friends who want to sake bomb and party! The wait staff is extremely attentive to groups that are sake bombing... Basically they keep the sake and beer flowing if you ask them to. The rolls are great and nicely priced too. Get the House special for sure!

excerpts: House sake is also 50% off, but I'm not a big sake drinker, passed this time.
Might be a good place to sake bomb.
sake.author: Kaje Y.
sake.review:
Came here on a Friday evening during happy hour. 

Asahi, Sapporo, Kirin, all 50% off; even the large bottles. Large bottles are 6.75ish and the regular bottles are 4.xx; so it's a good deal to go drinking. House sake is also 50% off, but I'm not a big sake drinker, passed this time. Might be a good place to sake bomb.

Next on the happy hour, is sushi. They have 3 hand rolls, and the rest are sashimi on rice. Each sashimi on rice comes with 2 pieces, and the hand rolls are well, hand rolls, OR 4 piece sushi. Each order is $2. A friend said the fish wasn't super fresh, but for $2 dollars, it's worth it. 

It was fairly empty on friday night at 6-7pm. Service picked up just a little bit as we left around 8pm. 

The music was kind of nice for me. Kick back with some emo music. They had some 98 degrees - I do, kelly clarkson - break away, lonestare - amazed, whitney houston - I will always love you, backstreet boys - drowning. 

Yes, I recognize it all. Some one else at our table doesn't really like this kinda music, but its nice for me once in a while. Lighter music. There's a parking garage across the street... after 6pm, its 1 dollar per hour parking! Good for if you can't find street parking.

excerpts: The bento box combo and happy hour sake/beer deal is fantastic!

excerpts: Especially on the sake
sake.author: Faith B.
sake.review: Love this place!  Me and my friends have been going here for 5+ years now- same owners, same great/reasonably priced sushi & great happy hour deals!  Especially on the sake :)

excerpts: Try the Ikura and their Sake/Salmon and you will see (taste;-)
The staff is so friendly and the place itself has its charm- nothing fancy- pop music and TV- and Polaroid pictures!-
it is a family sort of place.
And the price point is excellent.
sake.author: Elizabeth M.
sake.review: This is hands down the best quality sushi in the city.  Whenever I go to another sushi restaurant I end up disappointed because the fish quality of MSB is superior.  Try the Ikura and their Sake/Salmon and you will see (taste;-)  The staff is so friendly and the place itself has its charm- nothing fancy- pop music and TV- and Polaroid pictures!- it is a family sort of place.  And the price point is excellent.

excerpts: Second, they have a Happy Hour from 5-7 with $1.99 for some types of nigiri and rolls, half off beer/sake/sodas, and what more do you need?!
The service is a little below par, but who cares, I don't!
Go eat at Marina Sushi Bar...you will get addicted, like me!
sake.author: Casey S.
sake.review:
Marina Sushi Bar is LEGIT! First, the quality of their fish is amazing and it really doesn't get much better any where I have been in the city. Second, they have a Happy Hour from 5-7 with $1.99 for some types of nigiri and rolls, half off beer/sake/sodas, and what more do you need?! The service is a little below par, but who cares, I don't! Go eat at Marina Sushi Bar...you will get addicted, like me! I can't believe it took me 4 years of living in the city to try this place!

And, the potstickers are tasty!

excerpts: The sake is amazing.
The super white Tuna is mouthwatering, and can we just say-
they won't stop you when it comes to sake bombs.
Came here a few months ago, and look forward to coming back, as we were the last ones to leave, PAST CLOSING ( they didn't force or push us out).
Super friendly waitstaff.
The sashimi was just melt in your mouth perfection.
Look forward to our next encounter here!!!
sake.author: Jen M.
sake.review:
Soooooo....
Phenomenal Sashimi. The sake is amazing. The super white Tuna is mouthwatering, and can we just say- they won't stop you when it comes to sake bombs. Came here a few months ago, and look forward to coming back, as we were the last ones to leave, PAST CLOSING ( they didn't force or push us out). Super friendly waitstaff. The sashimi was just melt in your mouth perfection. Look forward to our next encounter here!!!

excerpts: Very loud crowd doing Sake bombs.
Mainly a young crowd.
I don't know if it's like that all the time though.
It was kind of annoying at times, but hey, they were having fun.
We sat at the bar.
The sushi chef was fast, but not talkative or engaging AT ALL.
Oh well.
sake.author: L R.
sake.review:
Came here at about 9:45 on a Saturday night (because we got back from sight seeing so late and were starving) and the place was pumping!  Very loud crowd doing Sake bombs.  Mainly a young crowd. I don't know if it's like that all the time though.  It was kind of annoying at times, but hey, they were having fun.  
We sat at the bar. The sushi chef was fast, but not talkative or engaging AT ALL.  Oh well. The service was prompt, but lacked friendliness. 

That being said....... We could actually taste how fresh the fish was!  It practically dissolved in our mouths. We tried sushi puzzle the night before, and although it was quieter and played more authentic music, the fish at Marina Sushi Bar surpassed sushi puzzle. 

I will make it a point to come here again when vacationing in San Fran.  This place is THAT good!!

excerpts: I kindly asked the manager what the hold up was while patiently waiting and she explained the problem and brought us each a glass of wonderful unfiltered sake.
What a nice gesture.
Arrigato...
sake.author: Meredith R.
sake.review:
Marina Bar is a great example of why second best is sometimes good enough. Think Avis "We Try Harder."

Case in point. This place is always my second place if I forget to call Zushi for a resv and they can't take me. I've been many, many times and while it's not the best sushi in town or in the neighborhood, it's always been a pleasant and yummy experience (though skip their miso, it's very sweet). The sushi is fresh, they have a good selection of rolls, sashimi, nigiri and other traditional dishes and the service is lovely but at times slow. All good though. 

Last night there was a "rice issue" and one of my rolls arrived quite late while my dinner partner was chowing down. I kindly asked the manager what the hold up was while patiently waiting and she explained the problem and brought us each a glass of wonderful unfiltered sake. What a nice gesture. Arrigato...

excerpts: Drink: Sake.
Beer if necessary.
Pound your fists and mix that shiz together.
sake.author: Tyler H.
sake.review:
I absolutely love MSB. Joyce is the biggest sweetheart, and the sushi is great. Also, they allow me to rage like I'm in college again, and it's socially accepted here--big plus. Needless to say, if you're not drinking or with a large group, you're probably not going to have a great time.

Food: House Special roll (spicy tuna, shrimp tempura, cream cheese and deep fried) or the Kits roll (shrimp tempura, eel, all wrapped with avocado).

Drink: Sake. Beer if necessary. Pound your fists and mix that shiz together.
